results.title: Beyond therapy
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Steven Haft, New World Pictures, Roger Berlind and Sandcastle 5
results.brief_description: Prudence (Julie Hagerty) is a conservative and slightly mixed-up young woman who thinks Bruce (Jeff Goldblum) is crazy. Bruce is crazy about Prudence, despite the fact that he is bisexual. Their therapists are no better off. Prudence’s therapist (Tom Conti) is more interested in scoring with his female patients than in treating their problems. Bruce’s therapist is as flighty as they come. Throw in Bruce’s jealous lover Bob (Christopher Guest), and his overly protective mother, and the scene is set for madness and mayhem. Adapted from his Broadway play by screenwriter Christopher Durang.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Altman, Steven Haft, New World Pictures, Roger Berlind and Sandcastle 5

results.title: Rabbit test
results.creator_credit: Joan Rivers, Edgar Rosenberg, Avco Embassy, Laugh or Die and Melvin Simon Productions
results.brief_description: Joan Rivers directs and stars in this acerbic comedy also starring Billy Crystal as a young virgin male, engaged to be married, who finds himself pregnant. His agony and ecstasy of being the first male to bear a child is paraded before an endless gallery of freaks and maniacs - his family and friends (not to mention the media).

results.title: Beyond reason
results.creator_credit: Telly Savalas, Howard W. Koch, Allwyn Pictures Corp and Arthur M Sarkissian
results.brief_description: Well-known TV actor Telly Savalas stars in “Beyond Reason”, the only film he wrote and directed. “Beyond Reason” is an intriguing exploration into the relationship between doctor and patient and the degree of humanity that is normally allowed in this relation. Savalas plays Dr. Nicholas Mati, a psychiatrist in a mental hospital with a very unconventional approach to his patients. In fact, the film opens with a high-energy sequence in which a group of men are gambling with dice; it only becomes clear later that this group comprises a doctor and his patients. This underscores Mati’s ‘eccentric’ approach toward psychic recuperation, he favours love, warmth and compassion over clinical distance; an approach, however, which gets him into conflict with his superior, makes some of his colleagues uncomfortable and even confuses his students during lectures. Above all, Mati is shown to treat his patients as ‘humans’, and with exactly the same warmth and affection with which he relates to his family and friends in the ‘normal’ world. However, a gnawing sense of anxiety and paranoia leads the doctor to a crisis of confidence, triggered when one of his students questions his particular philosophy. A series of delusions and imaginings in which his approach is questioned and mocked culminates in hallucinatory madness, and it’s not until then that the doctor breaks through his crisis and re-gains a position of normality and confidence. “Beyond Reason” affirms its pro-humanity stance when it suggests how easily we can all slip into madness and how important understanding and sensitivity are at such times. Cast also includes Diana Muldaur, Laura Johnson and Marvin Laird.

results.title: Playing for keeps
results.creator_credit: Bob Weinstein, Harvey Weinstein, Alan Brewer, Miramax Films and Playing for Keeps
results.brief_description: On graduating from high school friends Spike, Danny, Silk and Tracy are eager to make their mark on life but are concerned at their lack of suitable job prospects. When Danny discovers he has inherited the Majestic Hotel for the cost of $8000, he takes his friends and makes the move from the city to the country. With town planners on their back with a hidden agenda for a proposed chemical “preprocessing” plant and hostile townsfolk, it becomes a test of stamina to endure the persecution as well as continue the hard work required to renovate the dilapidated motel. Cast includes Daniel Jordano, Matthew Penn, Leon W. Grant, Mary B. Ward and Marisa Tomei.

results.title: Reuben, Reuben
results.creator_credit: Robert Ellis Miller, Walter Shenson and Taft Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Scottish poet past his prime has become an alcoholic and is dining off past glories, whilst living in an New England town. His penchant for successfully bedding a string of bored local wives, waylaying them with seductive poetry and sexual finesse, is derailed upon his encounter with the wholesome student Geneva Spofford (Kelly McGillis). Tom Conti plays Gowan McGland as an artist filled with self-loathing whose inability to recognise an opportunity for happiness makes him a tragic figure. Despite its at time depressing subject matter, “Reuben, Reuben” is an amusing romantic comedy about artistic drive and mis-matched lovers.

results.title: City girl
results.brief_description: Anne (Laura Harrington) is a photographer trying to advance her career taking snaps of high profile people in compromising situations. While working on a futuristic fashion shoot, she makes friends with two of the models, Gracie and Sugar, who also happen to dabble in prostitution on the side. Gracie particularly catches Anne’s interest when it is revealed that she has been in a relationship with Champagne Sam, one of the city’s most notorious pimps. Anne soon breaks up with her boyfriend, Joey (Joe Mastroianni), and starts leading the high life, frequenting strip clubs with her friends, and pursuing unsatisfactory relationships with a number of different men. However, Anne’s new-found freedom comes at a price; her latest photographic assignment turns into a nightmare when Champagne Sam, whom she was secretly photographing for an assignment, discovers that she has been hiding Gracie, and ransacks her apartment. Suddenly Anne realises how close she has come to total disaster. But has she realised too late?

results.title: Honky Tonk freeway
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Don Boyd, Howard W. Koch, AFD and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: When a new freeway is built that bypasses the tiny but thriving Florida town of Ticlaw, depriving it of the livelihood it garners from passing motorists, the mayor and other oddball citizens of the town dream up hair-brained schemes as a lure to the tourist trade. The film follows a group of equally eccentric range of travellers who inadvertently find themselves in Ticlaw—a place they never intended to visit. Cast includes Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D’Angelo, William Devane, Teri Garr and Geraldine Page.

results.title: Machine gun blues = Black rose of Harlem
results.creator_credit: Fred Gallo, Mike Elliott, Roger Corman and Pacific Trust
results.brief_description: Set in Harlem in 1931 during the era of depression, bootlegging, mobsters and smokey nightclubs where white patrons came to see black jazz singers. Also a time when the mafia were trying to move in on the nightclubs and assert their control over the black Americans, a time of violence and machine guns and death to those who dared to challenge “the boss”. Georgia Freeman (Cynda Williams), a black jazz singer and Johnny Verona (Nick Cassavetes) a white mobster who works for Costanza (Joe Viterelli), “the boss”, find themselves entangled in a fiery and passionate affair which eventually can only lead to disaster, especially when Johnny is already betrothed to Costanza’s daughter. When Costanza decides to take over the nightclub where Georgia sings, all hell breaks loose. Racial tension, dangerous liaisons, lots of action and a great jazz soundtrack with a cast including Lawrence Monoson, Richard Brooks, Garrett Morris, Richard T. Jones, Tony Burton and Maria Ford. Music produced by Paul di Franco.

results.title: Swing shift
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Jerry Bick, Lantana and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell star in this vivid look back at the wartime conditions that stood society on its head - and a sensitive, romantic story of the good times and the bad times a whole generation of Americans will never forget. The movie stays at home and follows the stories of men and women working in the factories that produce weaponry for the battles overseas, all produced predominantly by the round-the-clock efforts of over 3 million female workers. Many, like Hawn’s character Kay Walsh, have never held a wrench before - but you’re never too pretty to learn. Christine Lahti, co-starring as Kay’s sultry neighbour, Hazel, proves that even a dance-hall singer can handle a rivet gun. Russell plays Lucky Lockhart, the 4-F classified trumpet player who’d rather be handling real guns - until he falls in love with Kay. Kays’ husband Jack (Ed Harris) comes home on leave and finds out that his wife has betrayed him. Lucky then decides to pursue Hazel, driving a wedge between the two friends.

results.title: The In crowd
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosenthal, Keith Rubinstein, Lawrence Konner, Force Ten and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Its 1965, and rock’n’roll has ricocheted around the world. Nowhere is the music more popular than Philadelphia, where smooth-talking Perry Parker (Joe Pantoliano) hosts the city’s hottest TV show “Dance Party”. The dancing fever has also infected the suburbs where Del Green (Donovan Leitch), a high school senior, spends most of his time spinning, twisting and daydreaming of Vicky (Jennifer Runyon), “Dance Party’s” reigning teen goddess. On a dare Del foregoes his college entrance exam, auditions for the show, is chosen and becomes an instant success. Del and Vicky become “Dance Party’s” hottest new couple. To the beat of 60s rock’n’roll, and against a steamy backdrop of fancy footwork and raw competition, their make-believe romance becomes a doomed off-stage love affair.
